title: Haunted Doll Factory Adventure #41
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Doll Assembly Room
rooms.description: A dusty factory floor filled with abandoned workbenches and rusted machinery. Half-finished porcelain dolls lie scattered about, their empty eyes seeming to follow your movement. Cobwebs hang from the ceiling, and the air smells of old paint and decay. A flickering overhead light casts dancing shadows across the room.

items.name: old workbench
items.description: A wooden workbench covered in doll parts, tools, and dust

items.name: factory memo
items.description: A yellowed memo pinned to the workbench
items.text: MEMO: Production started in 1952. Remember to lock the storage cabinet - combination is the year we began production. - Manager Elias Crane

items.name: metal tool cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with three drawers, each labeled with different tool types

items.name: production logbook
items.description: A leather-bound book with production records
items.text: Crane Doll Factory - Est. 1952. Owner: Elias Crane. Specialty: Porcelain dolls. WARNING: The prototype doll created in the Prototype Workshop has been reported to move on its own. Keep locked away.

items.name: tarnished silver key
items.description: A small silver key with a tag reading 'Storage'

items.name: cracked porcelain doll
items.description: A damaged doll sitting on a shelf, its head tilted at an unnatural angle

items.name: hidden note
items.description: A small note stuffed inside the broken doll
items.text: If you're reading this, you need to destroy the cursed doll before it's too late. It's locked in storage. The furnace room is the only place hot enough to destroy it completely.

items.name: heavy wooden door
items.description: A door leading to the showroom, slightly ajar and creaking in an unfelt breeze

rooms.name: Doll Showroom
rooms.description: A large room with glass display cases lining the walls, each containing pristine porcelain dolls in elaborate dresses. Their glassy eyes seem to watch you from every angle. A grand chandelier hangs overhead, several of its crystals missing. Moonlight streams through grimy windows, casting an eerie glow. A locked storage closet stands in the corner, and a reinforced door leads north.

items.name: glass display case
items.description: A case containing a Victorian-era doll in a blue dress
items.text: Placard: 'Victorian Lady - Handcrafted by Elias Crane, 1955'

items.name: corner display case
items.description: A case with a bride doll in a white gown
items.text: Placard: 'Eternal Bride - Created in our Prototype Workshop, 1953. Not for sale.'

items.name: visitor guest book
items.description: A dusty book on a pedestal near the entrance
items.text: Last entry dated 1967: 'Beautiful dolls, but something feels wrong about this place. The owner, Mr. Crane, seems obsessed with his prototype. - Margaret Holloway'

items.name: locked storage closet
items.description: A reinforced closet with a silver lock and warning signs

items.name: cursed porcelain doll
items.description: A beautiful but deeply unsettling porcelain doll with jet-black hair and eyes that seem to follow you. Its presence fills you with dread. This must be destroyed in the furnace.

items.name: old newspaper article
items.description: A framed newspaper clipping on the wall
items.text: DAILY HERALD - 1967: Crane Doll Factory closes after mysterious incidents. Owner Elias Crane disappeared. Workers reported dolls moving on their own, particularly a prototype created in the factory's Prototype Workshop.

items.name: broken chandelier
items.description: A once-grand chandelier now covered in dust and cobwebs

items.name: reinforced metal door
items.description: A heavy door with a security panel. Three questions are etched into a brass plate beside it.

password_questions.question: Who owned this factory?
password_questions.hint: Check the factory memo and production log

password_questions.question: What did this factory make?
password_questions.hint: The production log states the factory's specialty

password_questions.question: Where was the cursed doll created?
password_questions.hint: Multiple sources mention where the prototype was made

rooms.name: Factory Furnace Room
rooms.description: A sweltering room dominated by a massive industrial furnace that still radiates heat after all these years. The walls are blackened with soot, and the air shimmers with waves of heat. A control panel with a large red button sits beside the furnace. This is where defective dolls were once destroyed - and where the cursed doll must meet its end.

items.name: industrial furnace
items.description: A massive brick furnace with an iron door. Orange light glows from within, and intense heat radiates outward.

items.name: furnace control panel
items.description: A panel with temperature gauges and a large activation button
items.text: WARNING: Furnace reaches 2000°F. Sufficient to destroy any material. Place items inside and activate to incinerate.

items.name: safety warning sign
items.description: A faded sign on the wall
items.text: SAFETY NOTICE: This furnace was used to destroy defective dolls and factory waste. Ensure area is clear before activation.

rooms.win_message: You place the cursed porcelain doll into the blazing furnace and activate the controls. The doll's eyes seem to widen in terror as the flames consume it. A piercing shriek echoes through the factory, then suddenly - silence. The oppressive atmosphere lifts, and you feel the curse break. The factory is finally at peace. You've completed your mission and can now escape this haunted place. You win!
